# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

Here is the Julia code that solves this problem:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lower case and remove leading and trailing whitespaces.
    col = lowercase(col)
    col = strip(col)
    
    # Replace spaces with underscores and hyphens with nothing (essentially removing them).
    col = replace(col, " " => "_")
    col = replace(col, "-" => "")
    
    return col
end

println(clean_column("My Column"))
```

When you run this code with the input `"My Column"`, it will output `"my_column"` as expected.
